description:
I posted the news footage a few posts ago.
CBS News has admitted that alarming footage of an overflowing ward used during a report on the coronavirus crisis in Big Apple hospitals was actually shot in Italy.
CBS’ breakfast show, “This Morning,” used the footage of a packed ward last Wednesday just after saying the pandemic’s epicenter was “found right here” in New York.
The same footage had been aired earlier by Sky News — which correctly identified it as one of Europe’s “most hard-hit” hospitals located in Bergamo, Lombardy. “It was an editing mistake,” a CBS News spokesperson told Fox News. “We took immediate steps to remove it from all platforms and shows."""""""" °
They took pre-recorded footage from italy
Said 'this is New York' but it was an editing mistake
Do you believe this was an editing mistake like they say, or do you think it was intentional to create more fear? 🤔 °
